scenarioDescription:
The 42 Dra Exoplanetary System


Overview

42 Dra is a star with 0.98 times the mass of the Sun, and 22.03 times its radius. It is located 295.68 light years away from the solar system and is estimated to be 9.49 billion years old, as compared to the Sun which is roughly 4.6 billion years old.

42 Dra is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the 42 Dra system


42 Dra b

42 Dra b was discovered by the Thueringer Landessternwarte Tautenburg observatory, in 2009-06, using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 1.19 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of 42 Dra b is 1233.840 times the mass of Earth. The radius of 42 Dra b is 13.000 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, 42 Dra b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system 42 Dra, which contains 1 exoplanets and was discovered by the Thueringer Landessternwarte Tautenburg.
name: 42 Dra - System With 1 Exoplanet
